poem:
Title: "Feathered Serenity"

From red-breasted robin to elusive yellowleg,
They drive us, these winged whisperers of the sky.
While mornings sag with mortgage, and cholesterol's dread,
In their swift continuum, our taxing worries lie.
An avian salve for middle-aged souls to spy,
And wonder at their freedom, unhinged, no bemoan.
In their ephemeral flight, we, too, feel we can fly.
